results.title: The Unlucky ones
results.brief_description: The film promotes the use of fire-resistant materials in the manufacture and purchase of children’s clothing and especially nightwear in the interests of child safety. Shot at the Royal Children’s Hospital, Melbourne, it shows children being brought in by ambulance and their treatment for burns and scalds, including skin grafting; also interviews by the surgeons with the parents about their children’s accidents. Co-produced with the Australian Wool Corporation and the Royal Children’s Hospital, Melbourne.

results.title: The Unlucky country
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Denys Brown and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: South Vietnam, a developing country facing the process of improving standards of living, health and education, against a background of constant dissension and war - the dual objectives to win a war and develop a country. Discusses the role of Australian Task Forces in establishing security and providing aid for civil development. Shows the work of the three medical teams.

results.title: The Unknown series (excerpts)
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In the ‘Unknown Series’, practical hands work with a sense of urgency to construct curious objects out of everyday things. This is a woman at work - not play. She is alone, assuming different persona, constructing objects that might appear to have no function but somehow reflect a state of mind and heart. Baldino has written, ‘Americans will sell you anything, even if they do not know what it is. So, I bought used ‘things.’ This series uses 30 of these objects in separate scenarios. I film a process that takes place in less than 60 seconds. This brief footage is an excerpt, which is actually the completed work. What happens before and after is unknown. Each piece is shot with different personas, and filmed in the first and final take’.

results.title: The Unknown land

results.brief_description: Scenes and songs of Australia’s northwest; the Pilbara and Kimberley areas, prospecting (old and new) and mining, pearling at Broome, the Ord River dam, and the cattle industry.

results.title: The Unknown Eiffel
results.creator_credit: Joan Laskoff and Lennox Art Group
results.brief_description: Biography of Alexandre Gustave Eiffel whoo pioneered metal construction techniques, including prefabrication. Shows some of his most famous works, quotations from Eiffel’s own writings, drawings and plans and contemporary paintings and drawings are used throughout.

results.title: The University years
results.creator_credit: Raymond Hancock and South Africa. Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: Illustrates the complexity of higher educational organisations and at the same time the wide range of facilities offered in a multi-national country such as South Africa. We see Rand, Port Elizabeth and Rhodes Universities: teaching situations, the study of electricity, teaching deaf children and veterinary studies.

results.title: The Universe and I: the future
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration and Kentucky Educational Television
